channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: Dozens of people were killed in Kazakhstan as authorities moved to curb antigovernment protests, Russian state media reported, while Moscow dispatched troops https://t.co/e18HHLhGnK
From @WSJopinion: The GOP has a duty to condemn the January 6 riot and those who refuse to acknowledge it, writes Karl Rove https://t.co/ApJSu3jqPq
With Covid-19 infections surging due to the fast-spreading Omicron variant, doctors are now urging people to ditch cloth face masks https://t.co/n5SZHsgJ3Z

Tennis star Novak Djokovic was denied entry to Australia and is being sent home ahead of the Australian Open. He had previously received a medical exemption to get around vaccination rules. https://t.co/RFBNCvguTr

Walmart and Kroger are among retailers raising prices for a popular at-home rapid Covid-19 test amid high demand for testing​ as the highly contagious Omicron variant spreads across the U.S. #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/Z61tC6uUoR

A petition to strip former British Prime Minister Tony Blair of his knighthood has garnered more than 700,000 signatures in a show of anger over his role in leading the U.K. to war in Iraq nearly two decades ago https://t.co/ASFQiydSuS
Former WeWork chief Adam Neumann has a new idea. He’s quietly assembling an apartment empire. https://t.co/RuXDPzs5CQ

From @WSJopinion: Ukraine and Taiwan aren’t mere regional hot spots, as Russia and China work together to upend world order, writes @sethcropsey. This is a contest for Eurasia—and thus for the world. https://t.co/KA4sGC4ev2

Breaking: Tennis star Novak Djokovic was denied entry to Australia and is being sent home ahead of the Australian Open. He had previously received a medical exemption to get around vaccination rules. https://t.co/yuTCRueXqN
Here’s what to know about the protests in Kazakhstan that threaten to destabilize the oil-rich former Soviet republic https://t.co/uecouhWCyV
Bloomberg Media's CEO Justin Smith said he is stepping down effective immediately to found a new media company to help address a crisis in trust among news consumers https://t.co/LXeXBf882v

Tennis superstar Novak Djokovic’s bid to play in the Australian Open—with a medical exemption to get around vaccination rules—was thrown into jeopardy on Wednesday amid a bureaucratic firefight over his entry at the country’s border https://t.co/0R5Jha8Nlx
Watch: Real estate in the metaverse is taking off. Here’s why investors are spending millions on virtual land. https://t.co/qVA49HOWzl

France's President Emmanuel Macron set off a wave of criticism from his political opposition Wednesday by using a vulgar term to lash out at unvaccinated people, framing their refusal to inoculate as a betrayal of French citizenship https://t.co/Tb618czjwk

Chicago Public Schools canceled classes Wednesday after the teachers union voted late Tuesday to stop providing in-person instruction, citing the latest spike in Covid-19 that has sent cases to record levels in the city https://t.co/O7TWkzd5j6
People who got a fourth shot of the Pfizer/BioNTech vaccine had a fivefold increase in antibodies one week later, according to data from Israel https://t.co/fCnifH4EPP
Toyota overtook General Motors as America's top-selling car company in 2021. It's the first time in decades that GM wasn't the No. 1 auto seller in the U.S. https://t.co/xrdRItcJbn
Mass protests in Kazakhstan over an increase in fuel prices have prompted the country’s authoritarian government to resign and the president to impose a state of emergency https://t.co/Q6N0VvVHBh

Hong Kong is banning passenger flights from eight countries, including the U.S., for two weeks, closing bars and banning evening dining in restaurants after the city’s first community Omicron infections https://t.co/PO0u5hB9IU

A new John Deere tractor sports the familiar green hue, classic yellow wheels—and an advanced artificial-intelligence system that allows the vehicle to operate without a driver https://t.co/dSSujtKjpY

Japan and Australia plan to sign a treaty that will allow their militaries to work more closely together, in the latest example of U.S. allies strengthening ties to counter the rising threat from China https://t.co/qnV0sA9F0Z
People who got a fourth shot of the Pfizer/BioNTech vaccine had a fivefold increase in antibodies one week later, according to data from Israel https://t.co/NPWb9LApxm
Fanatics has purchased the iconic baseball brand Topps as part of its growing takeover of the baseball-card industry https://t.co/xJVduHKiyz

Sen. Joe Manchin cast doubt on a Democratic push to change Senate procedures to weaken the minority party’s power, dealing a blow to party leaders’ effort to change the filibuster and advance their elections bills https://t.co/gFhXi0jjjz
Walmart and Kroger are raising prices for BinaxNOW rapid Covid-19 tests after the expiration of a deal with the White House to sell the kits for $14 https://t.co/QcRqO1fTQO

Americans preparing to get a Covid-19 booster can choose whether to stick with the same vaccine as their initial shots, or choose a different one. Here’s a look at advantages, disadvantages and side effects of mixing and matching. https://t.co/4bBTAsYZKm
Walmart and Kroger are raising prices for BinaxNOW rapid Covid-19 tests after the expiration of a deal with the White House to sell the kits for $14 https://t.co/EoxWjYxcbp
A lawyer for the administration of former New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo says a probe into its handling of Covid-19 in nursing homes has ended https://t.co/ehyazJgWrp
Theranos founder Elizabeth Holmes, who claimed she could revolutionize the blood-testing industry, was found guilty on four out of 11 criminal-fraud charges #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/czNAICxi0X

Novak Djokovic said he had received an exemption to play in this month’s Australian Open despite rules the country and the tournament have put in place requiring players to be vaccinated against Covid-19 to participate https://t.co/E6ehZNDkMM
Tesla has opened a new showroom in Xinjiang, the remote region where Chinese authorities are carrying out a campaign of forcible assimilation against religious minorities https://t.co/Keuy6xlOhx
U.S. steel producers are buying up scrap businesses, seeking a steady supply of raw material from junked cars, old pipes and manufacturing waste for new mills https://t.co/yXVizDGXO3
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/hnqxOQq0Ib https://t.co/6VTuYmezfB

Elizabeth Holmes could face up to 20 years in prison for each count for which she was found guilty, though former prosecutors say such a stiff sentence is rare in white-collar fraud cases https://t.co/y9Arn8kE0b

Coinbase CEO Brian Armstrong is the buyer of a $133 million Los Angeles estate, according to people familiar with the deal, in one of the priciest single-family home sales ever completed in the L.A. area https://t.co/xCOJ0VU20o
The New York attorney general’s office is seeking to interview two of Donald Trump’s adult children under oath https://t.co/WANInE1AAA

Meta Platforms said it removed a Facebook post by Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene (R., Ga.), a day after Twitter permanently suspended one of the representative’s verified accounts from its platform for violating its Covid-19 misinformation policy https://t.co/hXJkQta6Sm

The New York attorney general’s office is seeking to interview Donald Trump Jr. and Ivanka Trump under oath as part of its investigation into the former president and his company, according to a court filing Monday https://t.co/WwyVbCsZ5d
From @WSJopinion: “Baby boomers were carefree and exuberant; our children are dour and anxious” https://t.co/kmox3iPkEZ
Apple’s vision for life after the iPhone is coming into view https://t.co/amv4OBtX7Q

Football coach and commentator John Madden, who died Tuesday at age 85, made a complex sport sound like backyard fun. That’s a small part of Madden’s deep legacy, writes @JasonGay https://t.co/APXUxbz3Sf
Former Facebook executives said that after the whistleblower's disclosures, CEO Mark Zuckerberg told employees not to apologize https://t.co/Qu0TXfXios
From @WSJopinion: A 10-day treatment costs only $4 and appears to greatly reduce symptoms, hospitalization and death, writes Allysia Finley https://t.co/dYNhkWxoP7

From @WSJopinion: China’s Communist Party views all economic activity as fundamentally political. This week’s crackdown illustrates how no one is safe doing business in Hong Kong. https://t.co/q1uRLUPeVz
From @WSJopinion: Consolidation is wiping out private practices and making medical care costlier and worse, writes @DevorahCGoldman https://t.co/WBLrszq6Wn

From @WSJopinion: The 2022 Olympics have been scheduled under the orchestration of a genocidal regime, writes @iguangcheng. Can any self-respecting democratic nation agree to attend? https://t.co/TWCb4sRspm

Housing prices may seem astronomical, but millennials are buying in. The young people who once seemed doomed to rent can afford more house than earlier generations at their age, thanks to high incomes and low mortgage rates. https://t.co/taX7kVsVv6
How your student debt keeps growing, even when you keep paying https://t.co/qs0iSZOnv5
In a nuclear bunker under a mountain in New Jersey sits a remarkable secret treasure: tapes of every NBA game in the league’s archives https://t.co/eHifXe3bvQ
In the first 10 months of this year, American workers handed in nearly 39 million resignations. Bosses say rampant workplace burnout is a big problem. https://t.co/cnbBuphM1L
